title: First Olympic Games
description: The first recorded Olympic Games are held in Olympia, establishing the four-year cycle of the ancient Olympics.

title: Greek Colonization Begins
description: Greeks begin establishing colonies throughout the Mediterranean, spreading Greek culture and trade.

title: Rise of Tyrants
description: Tyrants begin to seize power in various Greek city-states, challenging aristocratic rule.

title: Solon's Reforms
description: Solon institutes major political and economic reforms in Athens, laying the foundation for democracy.

title: Cleisthenes Establishes Democracy
description: Cleisthenes reforms the Athenian constitution, establishing the world's first democratic government.

title: Battle of Marathon
description: Athenian forces defeat the Persians at Marathon, a decisive victory in the First Persian War.

title: Battle of Thermopylae
description: A small Greek force led by King Leonidas of Sparta makes a heroic stand against the Persian army.

title: Battle of Salamis
description: The Greek navy defeats the Persian fleet at Salamis, turning the tide of the Persian Wars.

title: Battles of Plataea and Mycale
description: Greek forces decisively defeat the Persians, ending the Persian invasion of Greece.

title: First Peloponnesian War Begins
description: Conflict breaks out between Athens and Sparta, beginning decades of warfare between the two powers.

title: Peloponnesian War Begins
description: The great war between Athens and Sparta begins, lasting 27 years and ending Athenian dominance.

title: Plague of Athens
description: A devastating plague strikes Athens during the Peloponnesian War, killing thousands including Pericles.

title: Athens Surrenders
description: Athens surrenders to Sparta, ending the Peloponnesian War and beginning Spartan hegemony.

title: Trial and Death of Socrates
description: Socrates is tried and executed for corrupting the youth and impiety, becoming a martyr for philosophy.

title: Battle of Leuctra
description: Thebes defeats Sparta at Leuctra, ending Spartan military dominance and beginning Theban hegemony.

title: Philip II Becomes King of Macedon
description: Philip II becomes king and begins transforming Macedon into a major military power.

title: Battle of Chaeronea
description: Philip II of Macedon defeats the combined forces of Athens and Thebes, establishing Macedonian dominance over Greece.

title: Alexander the Great Becomes King
description: Alexander succeeds his father Philip II and begins his legendary conquests across Asia.

title: Alexander Invades Persia
description: Alexander begins his invasion of the Persian Empire, winning decisive victories at Granicus and Issus.

title: Battle of Gaugamela
description: Alexander defeats Darius III at Gaugamela, effectively ending the Persian Empire.

title: Alexander Invades India
description: Alexander leads his army into India, reaching the furthest extent of his conquests.

title: Death of Alexander the Great
description: Alexander dies in Babylon at age 32, leaving his vast empire to be divided among his generals.

title: Death of Aristotle
description: Aristotle, one of the greatest philosophers in history, dies, leaving behind a vast body of work.

title: Battle of Ipsus
description: The successors of Alexander fight at Ipsus, leading to the final division of his empire.

title: Roman Conquest of Greece
description: Rome defeats the Achaean League and sacks Corinth, completing the conquest of Greece and ending Greek independence.

title: Sulla Sacks Athens
description: Roman general Sulla sacks Athens during the First Mithridatic War, ending the city's golden age.
